titleStmt.title: A pleasant ballad shewing how two valliant knights, Sir John Armstrong, and Sir Michael Musgrave, fell in love with the beautiful daughter of the Lady Dacres, in the north; and of the great strife that happen'd between them for her, and how they wrought the death of one hundred men. To an excellent new northers tune, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by and for W.O. and are to be sold by J. Blare, on London-bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "As it fell out one Whitsunday ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
